repository.corpname: University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center

did.abstract: The Doris Ulmann Photographic Collection (dated 1915-1925; 6 Boxes: 202 items; 3.5 cubic feet) consists of three different photographic collections totaling 202 unique items received by the library in 1970, 1978, and 1996 respectively.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to researchers by appointment.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Doris Ulmann, born in New York City in 1882, was the daughter of wealthy German immigrants. In 1900 she enrolled in New York's Ethical Culture School in New York and her photographic work became widely respected. Few individuals denied her request for a sitting. Her New York subjects included many intellectual and literary leaders such as Edna St. Vincent Millay, Sinclair Lewis, Albert Einstein, Paul Robeson, and Thomas Wolfe. Despite her work with the upper echelon of New York, her interest in the individual citizen was not lost. Intensely interested in the preservation of rapidly changing and even disappearing cultures, Ulmann made many trips to photograph the Gullah people of South Carolina; the Melungeons, African-Americans, Cajuns, and whites throughout Kentucky, Tennessee, Louisiana and North Carolina. Much of her time was spent in Eastern Kentucky photographing individuals in Letcher, Perry, and Knott counties among others. Some of her subjects were individuals who later became known for their craftsmanship, or musicianship, such as the Ritchie family of Viper, Kentucky.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: 96PA104: [Identification of item], Doris Ulmann Photographic Collection, 1915-1925, University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Jacobs, Philip Walker. The life and photography of Doris Ulmann. Lexington, KY: University Press of Kentucky, 2001.
Lovejoy, Barbara. The oil pigment photography of Doris. Lexington, KY: [s.n.], 1993. (University of Kentucky MA Thesis)
Ulmann, Doris. The Appalachian photographs of Doris Ulmann. Penland, N.C: Jargon Society, 1971.
Ulmann, Doris. Doris Ulmann: photographs from the J. Paul Getty Museum. Malibu, CA: The Museum, 1996.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Doris Ulmann Photographic Collection (dated 1915-1925; 6 Boxes: 202 items; 3.5 cubic feet) consists of three different photographic collections totaling 202 unique items received by the library in 1970, 1978, and 1996 respectively.

Collection PA70M1 consists of 16 original, signed portraits by Ulmann of mountain whites photographed in Kentucky, North Carolina, Tennessee and Georgia. There is no attached manuscript collection in the Special Collections and Digital Programs.
Collection 78PA101 consists of 32 original, signed silver gelatin prints by Ulmann. There is no attached manuscript collection in the Special Collections and Digital Programs.
Collection 98PA101 consists of 154 original, signed silver gelatin prints by Ulmann. There is no attached manuscript collection in the Special Collections and Digital Programs.

The 202 images represented on this site are digital surrogates of accessioned photographs housed in the Audio-Visual Archives of University of Kentucky. Text accompanying these images were derived from staff inventory descriptions of the photographs.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been assigned to the University of Kentucky.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of 16 original, signed prints by Doris Ulmann. It is housed in one box.
